resources.string: This device doesn\'t support Camera2 API.

string-array.name: models
string-array.item: Gyeongbokgung
Yeouido

string-array.name: model0
string-array.item:
Geunjeongjeon 근정전
 The throne hall
 Originally built in 1395 under King Taejo
 Burned down in 1592 during Japanese invasion
 Rebuilt in 1867

Gwanghwamun 광화문
 The Main and South Gate
 Originally built in 1395 under King Taejo
 Burned down in 1592 during Japanese invasion
 Rebuilt in 1867
 Moved to the south during Japanese occupation (1926)
Heungnyemun 흥례문\n The Second Inner Gate\n
Geunjeongmun 근정문\n The Third Inner Gate\n

Gyeonghoeru 경회루
 Royal Banquet Hall
 Originally built in 1412 under King Taejong
 Burned down in 1592 during Japanese invasion
 Rebuilt in 1867
 48 stone pillars

Hyangwonjeong 향원정
 Pavilion of Far-Reaching-Fragrance
 Built in 1873 under King Gojong
 Artificial island on lake Hyangwonji
 Linked to shore by Chwihyanggyo ("Bridge Intoxicated with Fragrance")

Hanbok 한복
 Traditional korean outfit
 Trace back to the Three Kingdoms of Korea period
 (1st century BC–7th century AD)
 Roots from northern Korea and Manchuria

Naegeumwi 내금위
 Military unit during the Joseon Dynasty
 between 1407 and 1910
 60-200 guards were present in the palace, protecting the king and the royal family.

National_Folk_Museum 국립민속박물관
 Established in 1945 by the U.S. Government
 98,000 artifacts and three main exhibition halls

Rank_stone
 Stones indicating rank in front of Geunjeongjeon Hall
 During official ceremonies, court officials would line up according to rank using these

string-array.name: model1
string-array.item:
Parc1
 Parc1 towers
 Tallest stands at 333 m (1,093 ft) with 69 floors
 $1.5-billion shopping/hotel/office complex
 Designed by architect Lord Richard Rogers

IFC 서울국제금융센터
 International Finance Center
 Complex of offices towers malls and hotels
 One of the first large-scale developments in Korea
 Officially launched in 2005, completed in 2012
 2nd tallest building in Seoul, 6th tallest in Korea.
 Designed by Arquitectonica

FKI
 Federation of korean industries head office
 245 m (804 ft) high, 5th tallest building in Seoul
 Completed in 2014
 Designed by the American firm Adrian Smith + Gordon Gill Architecture

S-trenue
 Mixed office and apartments building
 Designed by firm Mass Studies
 Completed in 2009

Conrad
 Luxury five-star hotel part of the IFC complex
 Belongs of Hilton Hotel Group
 434 guestrooms and suites spread throughout 38-stories

63
 63 SQUARE (formerly Hanwha 63 City)
 249 meters (817 ft) high
 Tallest gold-clad structure in the world
 Structure is based on the Hanja character for person or human being (人)
 Designed by Harry D. Som and Helen W. Som

LG
 LG twin towers
 143 meters for 34 floors
 Completed in 1987
 Designed by firm Skidmore, Owings and Merrill LLP

National_Assembly
 National Assembly of the Republic of Korea
 Consists of at least 200 members
 Completed in 1975
 The plenary chamber has seating for 400 people
 (In preparation for new lawmakers in case Korean reunification occurs)
